Description: Papyrus; Hieratic text. Published: KRI VI, 767-803; translation: Peet, Great Tomb Robberies (1930) I, 135-69.
Curator's comments: Frame now contains fragments added in mid-late 20th century. In 'Papyrus Consecutive Numbers' book, EA 10325 is described as 6 frames of 'Tomb Robbery Fragments', and is perhaps the source of these(?). Published: Kitchen, Ram. Insc. Vol 6 p767. A. Theodorides, Le sermente terminale de “vérité-mensonge”, RdE 21, p. 96 (4, 14). A. Theodorides, La Notion égyptienne de possession exprimée par la locution prépositive m-di, RdE 22, p. 141 (3, 20-21). A. Cabrol, Les voies processionnelles de Thebes, OLA 97, (2001), p. 567-571. Rde: 13, 58, 9). To be republished by CJ Eyre and M Collier (agreed 2006)
Half of the unplaced fragments seem to come from EA10042 (and some possibly from 10053 and 10054 also) (Mark Collier, pers. comm).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380850) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380850)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, fragmentary, insect attack Black ink Red ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast self adhesive linen tape Frame: at 2014, to be framed. Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
